word_mean: 震荡，震伤：强烈刺激或震动，或由这类损伤造成的结果

sentence.Network_en: Nicky was rushed to hospital with concussion.
sentence.Network_cn: 尼基因脑震荡被火速送往医院。

sentence.Network_en: He was taken to hospital with concussion.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因脑震荡被送进医院。

sentence.Network_en: He was carried off the field with slight concussion.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因轻微脑震荡给抬离了现场.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin concussio(n-), from the verb concutere 'dash together, shake' (see concuss)

entry.def: If you suffer concussion after a blow to your head, you lose consciousness or feel sick or confused.

example.ex: Nicky was rushed to hospital with concussion...
example.tran: 尼基因脑震荡被火速送往医院。

example.ex: She fell off a horse and suffered a concussion.
example.tran: 她从马上摔下来，造成了脑震荡。

means.word_mean: 1. injury to the brain caused by a blow; usually resulting in loss of consciousness

stems_affixes.word_buile: con全部+cuss摇动,敲打,震+ion动作或状态→全部摇动
per自始至终+cuss摇动,敲打,震+ion动作或状态→一直震动
re一再+percussion[n.敲打;碰击;冲突;震动]→一再引起震动
dis分开+cuss敲打→把[问题]分开敲→讨论
